data.title: 20 patriotic songs about US states
data.meta_description: To me, patriotism means taking pride in one's country or, in this case, state. Whether it's an upbeat tune or a slow ballad, these 20 artists turned their love for US states into classic hits.
data.text:
To me, patriotism means taking pride in one's country or, in this case, state. Whether it's an upbeat tune or a slow ballad, these 20 artists turned their love for US states into classic hits. Check them out below.

1 of 20

"California Love" by 2Pac

YouTube/2Pac

2pac's highly anticipated single after his release from prison was all about California's lifestyle and culture, specifically the sunny weather, flashing lights, and grand parties.

2 of 20

"Florida" by Vic Chesnutt

Sandlin Gaither/MCT/Sipa USA

Vic Chesnutt makes his love for the Sunshine State known in his 1991 song "Florida."

3 of 20

"Sweet Home Alabama" by Lynyrd Skynrd

YouTube/Lynyrd Skynrd

Can you name a better song to represent the state of Alabama? I'll wait.

4 of 20

"Alaska" by Maggie Rogers

YouTube/Maggie Rogers

Maggie Rogers experienced a life-changing transformation during a long hike on an Alaskan trail. She sings about the icy streams and glaciers that took her breath away.

5 of 20

"Arkansas" by Chris Stapleton

Andrew Nelles / USA TODAY NETWORK

Chris Stapleton's single "Arkansas" is about a thrilling road trip the singer took to get back to the state he loves most. "Gotta get down to Arkansas / Havin' so much that it's probably a little bit against the law."

6 of 20

"You Wild Colorado" by Johnny Cash

YouTube/Johnny Cash

Popular country singer Johnny Cash has sung about it all, including the beautiful state of Colorado. Throughout the song, he compares the Centennial State to one of his romantic interests.

7 of 20

"Blue Hawaii" by Elvis Presley

YouTube/Elvis Presley

If Elvis says dreams come true in Hawaii, dreams must come true in Hawaii.

8 of 20

"Native New Yorker" by Odyssey

YouTube/Top Pop

Wendy Williams once performed this song by Odyssey on The Masked Singer, so I know this song has to hit close to home for those from the Big Apple.

9 of 20

"Georgia On My Mind" by Ray Charles

YouTube/Ray Charles

Although Hoagy Carmichael first released this song in 1930, listeners are most familiar with Ray Charles' 1960 version. It's a soulful hit in which the singer makes his love for the Peach State known.

10 of 20

"Going Back To Indiana" by The Jackson 5

YouTube/The Ed Sullivan Show

The Jackson 5 sang about experiencing life in Hollywood, but to them, it was nothing compared to life in Indiana.

11 of 20

"Kentucky Dirty" by Laura Bell Bundy

Casey Flanigan/imageSPACE/Sipa USA

Laura Bell Bundy's country song "Kentucky Dirty" features lyrics that just feel Kentucky to their core. "Takin' our dance out of this city / Where the girls are fast and the horses pretty / Gonna get wild and a little bit flirty / Everybody, get Kentucky dirty."

12 of 20

"Nebraska" by Bruce Springsteen

Craig S. Semon/Telegram & Gazette / USA TODAY NETWORK

Bruce Springsteen switched his normal sound up from rock to folk with his 1982 single "Nebraska."

13 of 20

"Empire State of Mind" by Jay-Z, Alicia Keys

Yong Kim/Philadelphia Daily News/MCT/Sipa USA

Everybody knows Jay-Z reps Brooklyn harder than anybody else, so his entire first verse in "Empire State of Mind" is about the city that never sleeps. By the chorus, Alicia Keys belts out inspiring and moving lyrics about the place she calls home, saying New York is where dreams are made of.

14 of 20

"Ohio" by The Black Keys

YouTube/The Black Keys

This Akron-found band released their hit "Ohio" in 2010, which is about their love for the Buckeye State. They even mention the state's geography, including those rolling hills.

15 of 20

"Eugene Oregon" by Dolly Parton

Mark Zaleski / The Tennessean / USA TODAY NETWORK

Dolly Parton may be a Tennessee native at heart, but she's passionate about another US state: Oregon! "Oh, but Eugene, Oregon, you were kind / The love you gave was genuine / You gave me inspiration and the strength to carry on," she sings.

16 of 20

"Philadelphia Freedom" by Elton John

YouTube/Elton John

Elton John's song "Philadelphia Freedom" was dedicated to the legendary tennis player Billie Jean King and the people of Philly. "I live and breathe this Philadelphia freedom," he sings. Now, that's a lyric.

17 of 20

"Take Me Home, Country Roads" by John Denver

Howard L. Sachs / CNP/Sipa USA

Even though this song doesn't have West Virginia in the title, nobody can question John Denver's love for the state.

18 of 20

"California Gurls" by Katy Perry and Snoop Dogg

Andrew Nelles / Tennessean.com / USA TODAY NETWORK

Katy Perry said it herself: "You can travel the world, but nothing comes close to the golden coast."

19 of 20

"Song of Wyoming" by John Denver

Arnie Sachs / CNP/Sipa USA

John Denver's ballad "Song of Wyoming" is a moving performance from a man who wants nothing more than to be in the state he loves. He even says he can hear the coyotes singing and the birds chirping.

20 of 20

"TEXAS HOLD 'EM" by Beyoncé

Frank Micelotta/PictureGroup

You know I'm a Beyoncé fan, so there's no way I could leave her No. 1 country track "Texas Hold 'Em" off of this list.

Jacquez Printup has been writing about all things entertainment, including reality TV, pop culture, and celebrity news, since his time as a student at Ohio University. Since graduating, he's continued binging seasons of "Vanderpump Rules" and “Big Brother” and talking about them online. His writing has been featured in publications like ScreenRant, Yahoo, RealityTea, Yardbarker, and in the popular television series "The Real Housewives of Atlanta."
